column4: hi, does someone knows if it's possible to executs "ls" on a remote machine?
ssh allows you to have a remote shell and run any linux command
is it a server or desktop?
are you using a linux machine now?
open a terminal and type "ssh username@host.ip"
you need to replace the username and host
ah.. kubuntuser yeah I know that, but sorry, I meant from a script
you are on one machine, and want to ssh in a script to do ls?
hehe didnt know that worked, thanks
you need to make sure you put your public key on the access list of the other computer
I assume it would be bad if ssh wants a password?
